conclusion: There are four objects above a flat surface, and A, B, C, and D are the shadows cast by these objects on the ground. The light source is illuminating these objects from above.
The image shows four objects: a black hat, a glove, a peach, and a black calendar. Their respective shadows are labeled as A, B, C, and D.
The size and position of each shadow depend on the angle and distance between the light source and the objects.
The light source moves backward, which means it moves away from the objects.
When the light source moves backward, the shadows will shift towards the light source, moving closer to their respective objects on the ground.
As the light source moves backward, the angle at which light hits the objects becomes less steep, causing the shadows to become longer.
Shadow A will move closer to its object and become longer.
Shadow B will move closer to its object and become longer.
Shadow C will move closer to its object and become longer.
Shadow D will move closer to its object and become longer.
When the light source moves backward above the objects, each shadow (A, B, C, and D) will move closer to its respective object, and all shadows will become longer.
Final Answer: When the light source moves backward above the objects, all the shadows (A, B, C, and D) will move closer to the objects and become longer.
